intro: Lessingianthus pottii, commonly known as the yellow brittlestem, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features a slender, branching stem covered in fine, brittle hairs, giving it its common name. Its bright yellow flowers bloom in clusters, typically in the spring and summer months. Lessingianthus pottii is often grown as an ornamental plant for its vibrant color and unique foliage structure.
